headline: What's Going On With SanDisk Shares?
summary: SanDisk shares have been melting higher over recent months as its role in the broader AI frenzy finally comes into focus. The company helps headline an already-packed earnings docket this week, with massive growth forecasted for its broader current fiscal year.

headline: Miss the rally in memory stocks? Cramer sees an even better way to play the memory shortage
summary: Cramer says avoid buying Micron, Western Digital, Seagate and Sandisk stocks right now.

headline: Should Sandisk Stock Be in Your Portfolio Pre-Q2 Earnings?

headline: SanDisk and Western Digital are up 400% in 1 Year. Should You Still Buy?
summary: SanDisk (NASDAQ:SNDK) and Western Digital (NASDAQ:WDC) have seen explosive growth over the past year. The cause is pretty obvious: data centers. They require massive amounts of storage hardware, and both of these companies produce plenty. Unfortunately, all that production is not enough to meet demand. Hyperscalers alone are investing to the tune of $400 billion ... SanDisk and Western Digital are up 400% in 1 Year. Should You Still Buy?

headline: An Extreme Short Squeeze Is Underway in Sandisk Stock. How Much Higher Can Shares Go?
summary: Sandisk's short squeeze may be on ice for now, and one of its competitors appears to be much better positioned.

headline: Western Digital vs. Micron: Which Data Storage Stock Has More Upside?
summary: Micron edges out Western Digital as AI-driven memory demand, tight supply and a cheaper valuation make MU the more attractive pick now.

headline: Western Digital's Q2 Earnings on Deck: Is the Stock Worth Buying Now?
summary: WDC sees fiscal Q2 2026 non-GAAP revenue of $2.9B, up 20% year over year, as data center demand and high-capacity drives support growth momentum.

headline: Dear Sandisk Stock Fans, Mark Your Calendars for January 29
summary: AI demand is fueling SanDisk’s rally, and with the company set to release its Q2 numbers this week, the market will be watching closely.

headline: Why I'm Buying Sandisk Into Earnings
Tradr Debuts Leveraged ETFs on Lumentum, Sandisk and Western Digital
summary: Tradr ETFs, a provider of ETFs designed for sophisticated investors and professional traders, today launched three new leveraged ETFs on single stocks. The Cboe-listed funds seek to deliver twice (200%) the daily performance of a specific underlying stock. All three ETFs are first-to-market strategies.

headline: ValuEngine Weekly Market Summary And Commentary
summary: Many investors diversified portfolios away from US equities amid rising uncertainty. US equity funds recorded net outflows of $5.26 bln in the week ending Jan 21, reversing earlier inflows.
